sections.title: Definitions
sections.content: In this policy: 'Insured' means the person specified in the schedule. 'Hospital' means any institution established for in-patient care registered with state authorities with a minimum of 10 beds. 'Pre-Existing Disease' means any condition diagnosed or treated within 48 months before first policy inception. 'Network Provider' means hospitals, clinics, and diagnostic labs in CarePlus's empanelled network.

sections.title: Scope of Cover
sections.content: CarePlus Basic provides essential health coverage for in-patient hospitalization due to illness or accident. This is an affordable entry-level plan designed for individuals seeking basic coverage. Coverage is subject to plan limits, waiting periods, and policy exclusions.

sub_sections.title: Room Rent
sub_sections.content: Room rent is covered at ₹2,500 per day (general ward) or ₹4,000 per day (semi-private room). ICU charges covered up to ₹6,000 per day. Proportionate deduction applies if insured opts for a higher category room.

sub_sections.title: Minimum Hospitalization
sub_sections.content: A minimum hospitalization of 24 hours is required. This plan covers 200 listed day-care procedures without minimum stay.

sub_sections.title: Pre-Hospitalization
sub_sections.content: Medical expenses incurred within 15 days before admission are covered for the same illness requiring hospitalization.

sub_sections.title: Coverage Limits
sub_sections.content: Maximum annual hospitalization benefit is ₹3,00,000. Room rent ₹2,500/day (general) or ₹4,000 (semi-private), ICU ₹6,000/day. Basic coverage includes surgeon fees, medicines, and diagnostics during hospitalization only.

sub_sections.title: Post-Hospitalization
sub_sections.content: Post-discharge medical expenses are covered for 30 days after discharge, related to the hospitalized condition.

sub_sections.title: Initial Waiting Period
sub_sections.content: A general waiting period of 30 days applies from inception. Accidental hospitalizations are covered from Day 1.

sub_sections.title: Specific Disease Waiting Period
sub_sections.content: A waiting period of 2 years applies for conditions including Hernia, Cataract, Hysterectomy, Joint Replacement, and chronic kidney disease.

sub_sections.title: Pre-Existing Disease Waiting Period
sub_sections.content: Pre-existing diseases are covered after a waiting period of 4 years (1460 days) of continuous coverage. This is the standard waiting period for this basic plan tier.

sub_sections.title: Surgical Coverage
sub_sections.content: Surgical procedures are covered after 90 days of policy inception (except accidental surgeries from Day 1). Standard surgeries are covered; however, robotic surgeries are not covered under this basic plan. Surgeon fees are subject to a sub-limit of ₹25,000 per surgery.

sections.title: No Claim Bonus
sections.content: 5% increase in Sum Insured for every claim-free year, subject to a maximum of 25% of base Sum Insured. NCB lapses entirely if a claim is made in any policy year.

sub_sections.title: Maternity Benefit
sub_sections.content: Maternity coverage is NOT included in CarePlus Basic. Maternity expenses must be borne by the policyholder. Upgrade to CarePlus Premium or CarePlus Family plan to avail maternity benefits.

sub_sections.title: Dental Coverage
sub_sections.content: Dental treatment is NOT covered under this plan unless necessitated by accidental injury, which is covered under standard hospitalization benefits from Day 1.

sub_sections.title: Vision Care
sub_sections.content: Spectacles and contact lenses are NOT covered under CarePlus Basic. Cataract surgery is covered as a day-care procedure after 2-year waiting period.

sections.title: Exclusions
sections.content: Not covered: pre-existing diseases during waiting period, maternity and newborn expenses, cosmetic surgery, infertility treatments, substance abuse, war injuries, STDs/HIV, experimental treatments, dental and vision care (except accident), OPD consultations, psychiatric treatment, vitamins and supplements, administrative expenses, and treatments outside India.

sub_sections.title: Cashless Facility
sub_sections.content: Available at 3,200+ Network hospitals. For planned admission: 48 hours prior intimation required. For emergency: within 24 hours of admission.

sub_sections.title: Reimbursement
sub_sections.content: Claims must be filed within 7 days of discharge. Required: discharge summary, bills, prescriptions, and investigation reports. Processing within 30 working days.
